title: ARGIOPE
content:
ARGIOPE was a Naiad-nymph of the town of Eleusis (southern Greece). She was the mother by Poseidon of Kerkyon
        (Cercyon), a brutal Eleusinian king slain by the hero Theseus.

Argiope's name means "Silver-Faced" which suggests she was the nymph of a sparkling spring or brook.

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca E1. 3 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "[Theseus] slew Kerkyon (Cercyon), son of Brankhos (Branchus) and a Nymphe named Argiope [of
        Eleusis]."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
